p: At pH = 3, the carboxyl groups of amoxicillin (pKa 1 = 2.7) are completely ionized [ 51], which accounts for higher release rates and diffusion coefficients at low pH values (electrostatic repulsion between the –COO– from amoxicillin and the –OSO 3 − groups of carrageenan). The higher the carrageenan content in the hydrogels, the higher the release rate for amoxicillin at pH = 3. At higher pH values (6.5 and 7.3), increasing of the carrageenan amount has an opposite effect. The amino groups become ionized in higher numbers, leading to a decrease with up to 40% in the release rates for this drug at pH = 7.3, compared with pH = 3. For the same pH value, a variation of 15% in the amoxicillin diffusion rates can be registered between the PC12 blend hydrogel and PVA.
